events.name: Keynote Special: Andrew Keys (Consensys & Enterprise Ethereum Alliance)
events.description:
Dear fellow Etherians, In line with our own March Madness, we have lined up Chris Hitchcott to speak on the Digix Stack and Truffle, an Ethereum Development Framework by Consensys, and Andrew Keys to present a keynote special on Consensys and the Enterprise Ethereum Alliance. 


About the Speakers: 1. Chris Hitchcott (Core Developer, Digix):  Chris founded and operated a Hong Kong based app development team that delivered interactive technology to conferences. He worked at Ethcore before moving back to Asia to join Digix. 2. Andrew Keys (Head of Global Business Development): Andrew comes to ConsenSys with capital markets, technology, and entrepreneurial experience. Previously, Andrew worked for UBS investment bank in equities analysis. Later, he was responsible for creation and distribution of life settlement products to hedge funds and investment banks. After, he co-founded a revenue cycle management company where he learned about Bitcoin and eventually Ethereum. Andrew drives strategic technological partnerships, business development, and communications for ConsenSys and co-founded ConsenSys Enterprise, to create Ethereum blockchain solutions for Fortune 500 clientele. Andrew graduated from Loyola University Maryland and University of Auckland with degrees in economics and international finance. About the Enterprise Ethereum Alliance:  The Enterprise Ethereum Alliance connects Fortune 500 enterprises, startups, academics, and technology vendors with Ethereum subject matter experts. Together, we will learn from and build upon the only smart contract supporting blockchain currently running in real-world production – Ethereum – to define enterprise-grade software capable of handling the most complex, highly demanding applications at the speed of business.In partnership with the dedicated and robust Ethereum community, Enterprises are coming together to produce the industry standard, open source, free to use blockchain solutions that will be the foundation for businesses going forward. Please RSVP and turn up responsibly due to the limited seats available at the event venue, thank you! Event Schedule: 6:30 - 7:00 pm : Registration 7:00 - 7:30 pm: Speaker 1, Chris Hitchcott (Digix) 7:35 - 8:30 pm: Speaker 2, Andrew Keys (Consensys) 8:30 - 9:00 pm: Networking and closing Event organizers:    





Venue sponsor:  Regards Ethereum Singapore Organizers

events.name: Tech Workshop - MOE Learning Buildathon 2017
events.description:
The Tech Workshop is designed give you an overview of the tools and platforms you can use to prototype your solution at the first-ever MOE Learning Buildathon (25-26 March). Teams from Microsoft and Apple will do hands-on tutorials with you.
Please note that participants at this workshop will require some prior coding knowledge and experience. 
Also, check out the Content Workshop (Thursday evening, 16 March), where you can learn about the Buildathon challenges.
If you have any questions, please send us an email at hello@upsingapore.com.
events.location: LEVEL3, Mapletree Business City, East Wing,, 20 Pasir Panjang Road, #03-22/24, Singapore 117439

events.name: Our very first meet up
events.description: NUS Enterprise have kindly agreed to host the first meet up at Plugin@BLK71. See you all there. Agenda for first meeting would be: -- Meet and greet-- Discuss on what the meet up format should be-- How frequently we all should meet-- Others as what may come up during the meet up See you all. I will post if any further developments. Please bring along your colleagues or friends who may be interested in the event. Cheers! Location:  NUS Enterprise @ Blk71 #02-01, 71, Ayer Rajah Crescent, 139951 Venue sponsored by NUS Enterprise
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71 , 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent #02-01 , NUS Enterprise@Blk71 , 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent #02-01 , Singapore

events.name: March Meetup
events.description:
Greetings, fellow craftspeople!  We're thrilled to have another installment of API Craft Singapore meetup in March. Learn more about APIs in 2017! 


Programme  7.00pm: Doors open - mingle over food and drinks 7.20pm: Start of session, opening address by hosts 7.30pm: Start of scheduled talks 9:00pm: Community announcements / End of event  Scheduled Talks • 'API in HTTP2 world' by Wang Eric GaoXiang   • 'API archeology - the story of APIs before JSON dropped in' by Stephan H. Wissel •'Building Next Generation APIs with Python, PostgresQL, JWT, and LXC' by Vikrant 



Job Opportunities  Have a job position you'd like to announce? Contact us from the 'Contact' button on the sidebar, and we'll post it here. 


Information for Attendees **Please bring a photo ID to get through building security!** The meetup will be held at 240 Tanjong Pagar, Keppel Towers 2, Level 08, Singapore. If you're traveling by MRT, the closest MRT station is EW15 Tanjong Pagar. 


Sponsors  





Community   Join our Slack group: http://bit.ly/apicraftsgslack­
events.location: Singapore Power, 240 Tanjong Pagar, Keppel Towers 2, Level 08
